content.raw:
Thanks Steve. This brings me to other hypothesis: 

* We are not building the ogre package correctly. Checking out the [rules file in our fork](https://github.com/j-rivero/ogre-acornacorn/blob/master/debian/rules) and in  [ogre-1.8 in ubuntu trusty](http://anonscm.debian.org/cgit/pkg-games/ogre-1.8.git/tree/debian/rules) I can not see any difference.
* Shadows are somewhat broken in our fork code.
* Shadows are not compatible / not working together with 3D.

Does the ogre-1.9 in Trusty/Vivid support 3D?
content.html:
Thanks Steve. This brings me to other hypothesis:

  • We are not building the ogre package correctly. Checking out the rules file in our fork and in ogre-1.8 in ubuntu trusty I can not see any difference.
  • Shadows are somewhat broken in our fork code.
  • Shadows are not compatible / not working together with 3D.

Does the ogre-1.9 in Trusty/Vivid support 3D?
